means: 灌输，加入（一种特性）( infuse的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A strange spirit infused the place.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个地方散发着一种奇特的气质。

sentence.Network_en: Her novels are infused with sadness.
His arrival infused new life and energy into the team.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的到来为这支队伍注入了新的生命力和活力.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 传统上根据不同对象,德行可分二大类并以不同的名称称呼它们,即本性的(natural)及超性的(supernatural)德行,修成的(acquired)及倾注的(infused)德行,伦理的(moral.
This visit had infused new vigor into Dant è s ;, 那次巡查又在唐太斯的心中重新燃起了希望.
...请被重复地扩大，“上帝片段体”将会持续成形为一种鼓舞的(infused)，精神导向的(spirits-led)意识，这种意识会在〝人类仪具〞尘世 …
...力、通讯、教育等。从基督徒神学，可将人性各方面的因素视为恩宠↗grace的前提性母体↗matrix。infused 灌注的,灌输的,倾注的infusio (拉) 灌注,灌输,倾注 ↗infusion

医用术语中英文对照表-梁子同志 ... infusion outfit 注射器（全套） infusion pump 输液泵 infusion rubber tubing 输液皮管.

entry.def: To infuse a quality into someone or something, or to infuse them with a quality, means to fill them with it.

example.ex: Many of the girls seemed to be infused with excitement on seeing the snow...
example.tran: 看到雪,许多女孩似乎一下子变得兴奋起来。

example.ex: A union would infuse unnecessary conflict into the company's employee relations.
example.tran: 工会会把不必要的冲突带入公司员工关系当中。

entry.def: If a quality infuses something, every part of that thing has that quality.

example.ex: A strange spirit infused the place.
example.tran: 那个地方散发着一种奇特的气质。

entry.def: If you infuse things such as tea leaves or herbs, or allow them to infuse, you put them in hot water for some time so that the water absorbs their flavour. You can also infuse things in other liquids.

example.ex: ...teas made by infusing the roots of herbs...
example.tran: 浸泡草药根沏成的茶水

example.ex: Herbalists infuse the flowers in oil...
example.tran: 草药大夫把花朵浸泡到油里。

auth_sentence.content: Soon after, peach-infused Jameson landed on the drinks list.
